definition: with single-hearted devotion (idiom)
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey
aspiration/ambition/the will

sentences.english: I am willing to learn English single-mindedly.
sentences.chinese: 我願意專心致志地學英語。

sentences.english: He must have been competely wrapped up in his thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 他那時一定是在專心致志地思考問題。

sentences.english: Science only bestows the grandest favour on those who concentrate on it.
sentences.chinese: 科學只把最高的恩典賜給專心致志地獻身於科學的人。

sentences.english: One night, Mario was engrossed in his Famicom game.
sentences.chinese: 一天夜裏，馬里奧正在專心致志的打遊戲。

sentences.english: Usually she was absolutely single-minded, whether in agreement or disagreement.
sentences.chinese: 無論贊同與否，她通常都是絕對專心致志地聽着。

sentences.english: The specialist is one of those single-minded, self-starting, dedicating kind of people.
sentences.chinese: 專業師是專心致志，自勵，有獻身精神的人。

sentences.english: He was devoted to Pure Science.
if one does not give single-hearted devotion to it, no skills will be learned.
sentences.chinese: 不專心致志地學習，什麼技能都學不會。

sentences.english: He was so absorbed in a book that he did not hear the bell.
sentences.chinese: 他如此專心致志地讀書以致沒聽見鈴響。

sentences.english: The atmosphere of study congragetes with participants dedicating all their attention to studying.
sentences.chinese: 晨讀教室的氛圍很好，同學們在專心致志的學習。

sentences.english: Keep your focus on the person you are meeting - give them the respect you would like to receive.
sentences.chinese: 專心致志與人交談，給予他們你想得到的同等的尊重。

sentences.english: The more you apply the better you will work.
sentences.chinese: 你越專心致志，就工作得越好。

sentences.english: He ate all three cans of dog food with an awe-inspiring20 singleness of purpose.
sentences.chinese: 那狗專心致志地把3聽狗食全喫光了。

sentences.english: Absorbed in the work, he neglected food and sleep.
sentences.chinese: 他專心致志於這項工作，到了廢寢忘餐的地步。

sentences.english: Ingesting food should be unhurried, moderate, careful in the chewing and slow in swallowing.
sentences.chinese: 進食時應該從容緩和，專心致志，細嚼慢嚥。

sentences.english: Heads bent, they were much too intent on embroidery.
sentences.chinese: 她們埋着頭，專心致志地刺繡。

definition: to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
to concentrate one's attention (idiom)
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
calm/unruffled
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
loyal/sincere/sound
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
